name: 陳孝行
objective: This class will provide current knowledge of membrane process for water treatment, including reverse osmosis, nanofiltration, ultrafiltration, microfiltration, forward osmosis and membrane bioreactor. The theories include pretreatment, mass transfer, fouling, scaling, membrane cleaning, post treatment and practical application.
schedule:
Week　　Contents
1　　Overview
2      RO/FO/NF/UF/MF (PPT)
3      RO/FO/NF/UF/MF (PPT)
4      Recovery /Scaling/Pretreatment
5      Scaling calculation- One species and two species
6      Membrane specification/Membrane materials/Fouling
7      Midterm #1
8      Fouling index (SDI and MFI)
9      Design you membrane system ROSA (http://www.dowwaterandprocess.com/)
10    Rejection mechanisms-Determine membrane charge by Mineql+
11    Design your membrane system-IMS software (www.membranes.com)
12    Technical bulletin for membrane cleaning
13    Midterm #2
14    Post treatment
15    Forward Osmosis
16    MBR and OMBR
17    Final report and presentation
18    Final Exam.
scorePolicy:
Mid term twice　　20 %, 20 %
Final examination　　20 %
Homework　　          20 %
Report and presentation　　20 %
materials:
(1)　　Water treatment principles and design by MWH, J. M. John Wiley and Sons, New York, 2012. (Chap 12: membrane filtration and Chap 17: Reverse Osmosis)
(2)　　Environmental Chemistry for a sustainable world: Nanotechnology, Food security and Water treatment by Springer. (Chap 6: Sustainable Desalination Process and Nanotechnology.)
